required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mohs Surgery: Patient Satisfaction & Quality of Life (QOL)
clinical_study.official_title: Patient Satisfaction Improvement and Quality of Life Measurement in Mohs Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine whether there is significant difference between two groups: extra care (EC) and usual care (UC) in improvement of patients' quality-of-life (QoL) scores between the baseline and 90-day post-surgery in patients undergoing Mohs micrographic surgery (MMS).

primary_outcome.description: Patient Satisfaction Questionnaire (PSQ) is a 7 item questionnaire with a total score ranging from 7 to 35 with the higher score indicating greater satisfaction

arm_group.description: Participants in this group will receive the EC intervention pre and post standard of care (SoC) scheduled Mohs Surgery.
Participants in this group will receive the usual care provided to patients undergoing standard of care (SoC) scheduled Mohs Surgery.

intervention.description: The EC intervention includes pre- and post- procedure calls from the surgeon, written educational material, personalized music during the operation, post-procedure skin cancer protection education, and are allowed to bring a guest into the procedure room.
Standard of care pre and post surgery management provided to patients undergoing Mohs Surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Female and/or male subjects undergoing Mohs micrographic surgery for Basal Cell Carcinoma (BCC) and/or Squamous Cell Carcinoma (SCC).
2. Subjects must be at least 18 years of age.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects who are not able to complete the surveys (pre-surgery, 1 week post-surgery, and 3 months post- surgery)
2. Subjects under the age 18
3. Subjects unable to consent
4. Subjects who are not undergoing Mohs micrographic surgery for Basal Cell Carcinoma (BCC) or Squamous Cell Carcinoma (SCC).
